Bruno Glecer

El proyecto del presente año para la materia Electrónica Aplicada 3 consta de la construcción del front-end de un sistema de radar de onda continua modulada en frecuencia (FMCW). Una parte crítica de este sistema es el amplificador de bajo ruido (LNA).

Durante el transcurso del primer cuatrimestre se desarrollaron los fundamentos teóricos sobre los que se basa el mismo, seguido de un diseño de un PCB sobre el cual implementar el circuito.

My Projects

Real-time EM Simulator

A real-time electromagnetic simulator built in JavaScript using GPU computation, this project visualizes how electric and magnetic fields respond to the movement of a charge controlled by the user’s cursor.

Portable SiPM Testbench (Thesis Project)

SiPM testbench for characterizing SiPM performance (DCR, SPE, Dark current) based on custom electronics and a Red Pitaya FPGA Board. Portability offers a robust solution of SiPM irradiation campaigns.

ReSnap Wireless Charger

Developed the electronics for the prototype for the startup ReSnap. Designed highly compact board integrating Qi transiever, reciever, controller and LiPo charge controller.

1 GHz Low Noise Amplifier

Project for the RF measurements course. The amplifier was designed for minimum noise figure and simulated using CST Studio. Measurements were carried to ensure match between theory and simulations.

A Prime-Generating Constant

We present a constant and a recursive relation to define a sequence fn such that the floor of fn is the nth prime. Therefore, this constant generates the complete sequence of primes. We also show this constant is irrational and consider other sequences that can be generated using the same method
